title.narrative: ENVIRONMENTS LOCAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: 1.2.1 By 2017, 20 cantons with the lowest welfare indicators have improved protection services against the different forms of violence for children and adolescents, in the family, the community and the school., which contributes to Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.2 By 2017, the capacity of the child protection system is increased to implement innovative strategies to prevent and protect children against the various forms of violence within the schools, families and the community

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.2.1 By 2017, 20 cantons with the lowest welfare indicators have improved protection services against the different forms ofviolence for children and adolescents, in the family, the community and the school.

description.narrative: Cantons with improved welfare indicators have improved protection services against different forms of violence. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2018

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.1.1: Number municipal plans that incorporate strategies and social programs to address inequities /disparities for children.

baseline.value: 3 municipal plans (Source: Municipal capacity strengthening program, Institute for Municipal Development and Assistance (IFAM) and the Ministry of Decentralization and Local Development.)

target.value: 2017:25 Municipalities have priority programs to reduce different forms of violence against children and adolescents. Strategies and programs are being replicated in 10 cantons.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.1.6: Children

actual.value: 2017:During 2017, UNICEF is supporting MIDEPLAN in the development of the metodology of the new IBINA. This index will use data from the Social Maps System for Children and Adolescents.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.1.2: National Plan for the Prevention of Violence against Children and Adolescents implemented.

target.value: 2013:By 2013, a National Plan for the Prevention of Violence against Children and Adolescents elaborated.

actual.value: 2017:During 2017, the CO suppor the formulation of the National Plan for the Development of Strategies for the Prevention and Eradication of Violence (2017-2019), which was launched in september 2017.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.1.4: An advocacy and social mobilization strategy for the fight against violence against children, adolescents and women.

actual.value: 2017:Advocacy strategy formulated in 20 cantons vulnerable and replicating in 36 cantons.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.1.3: Articulation and implementation of a strategy for the prevention of violence against children and adolescents generating behavior and practice changes within schools, families and the communities.

target.value: 2017:Strategy designed and implemented by 2015, and evaluated in 2017.

actual.value: 2017:In 2017, the CO continue the support of the strategy for the prevention of violence was promoted in 4 communities: Guarari of the canton of Heredia, Guapiles of the canton of Pococi, La Capri of the canton of Desamparados and the dikes of the canton of Cartago that have high levels of violence and t

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.1.5: Sports and cultural programs to prevent violence, which are coordinated by national or local government, are available to children and adolescents.

baseline.value: The strategy for the promotion and implementation of social programs for children elaborated in 1st semester of 2013.

target.value: 2017:20 cantons have safe recreational areas for children and adolescents and offer a variety of cultural, sports and recreational programs.
